name: ASHS-ABC-3T
shortdesc: Hippocampal and MTL subfield segmentation in 3 Tesla T2-MRI (2022 version)
longdesc: Automatic segmentation of hippocampal subfields and MTL subregions in high-resolution T2-weighted 3 Tesla MRI scans, using an atlas of older adults with and without mild cognitive impairment from the Penn Aging Brain Cohort (ABC).

tags.name: T2-MRI
tags.hint: A high-resolution (e.g., 0.4x0.4x2.0mm^3) T2-weighted MRI scan with oblique coronal orientation parallel to hippocampal main axis. This scan must be the main image in the workspace.

tags.name: T1-MRI
tags.hint: Roughtly isotropic (e.g., 1x1x1mm^3) T1-weighted MRI scan of the whole brain.

tags.name: AC
tags.hint: Anterior commissure point can be optionally specified to help align the MRI scan to the brain template.

tags.name: PC
tags.hint: Posterior commissure point can be optionally specified to help align the MRI scan to the brain template.

parameters.name: corr_mode
parameters.hint: ASHS offers performs segmentation error correction based on a machine learning algorithm. The 'intensity and shape correction' mode is suitable when your data closely matches the intensity characteristics of the ASHS atlas (see paper for details). Otherwise , 'shape correction' is recommended. You may also choose to disable error correction.
